results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Bryna Productions, Edward Lewis and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.

results.title: Sparrow
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, In Posse, Trish Carney and Polly Watkins
results.brief_description: A young family lives isolated in rural Australia with the father, a truckie, almost always away. Sparrow asks her mother what the difference is between ghosts and spirits as she ponders the death of the family dog. The mother remains emotionally distant until Sparrow’s curiosity with death leads her to dig up a family secret. ‘Sparrow’ explores the quiet of the emotions within a family and creates a portrait of emotional distance affirmed with the slow pace of country life and the very distant horizon. Cast includes: Molly McCaffrey and Leverne McDonnell.

results.title: Sparky the colt
results.brief_description: Part of the series “Background for reading and expression”. The film tells the story of the first weeks in the life of a colt, showing how he becomes acquainted with the farm and makes friends with his young master.

results.title: Sparky's magic piano
results.brief_description: Eight-year old Sparky hates to practise! One day his piano speaks to him and shows him what it is like to play the piano well - the piano will do it for him. Suddenly Sparky is hailed as a musical genius, but he becomes arrogant, rude to his family and the piano, so the piano refuses to play at the most important concert of his career … Voices include Mel Blanc, Coral Browne, Tony Curtis, Cloris Leachman and Vincent Price.

results.title: Sparkling canals in Shaoshan
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio
results.brief_description: In 1958 the Chinese people of ShaoShan in Hunan Province, built a reservoir on the middle reaches of the Yangtze River for the irrigation of the fields. It was eventually abandoned through fear of the counter-revolution until 1965 when it was resurrected again to prevent droughts and/or floods over 2500 square kilometers. This film documents the rebuilding of the irrigation canals under the guidance of Chairman Mao and the manual labour of the Chinese peasants. ShaoShan is the birthplace of Chairman Mao.

results.title: Spanking the monkey
results.creator_credit: Buckeye Films, Dean Silvers and David O. Russell
results.brief_description:
This black comedy was an indie hit for director/writer David O. Russell, with the content of the narrative, and the title of the film (a non-de-plum for masturbation) causing a minor furore. Ray, an introverted student studying to be a surgeon, returns home for what he intends to be a brief stay prior to taking up an internship. Upon his arrival however his controlling father presses him into caring for his physically compromised and emotionally depressed mother. As Ray assists his mother with her recuperation, their bond becomes incestuous in tone and increasingly bizarre. With an eye for the absurd and a heavy tilt toward black comedy, this film’s Oedipal overtone encourages uncomfortable audience participation in what is a rarely explored subject matter. The pathos of the screenplay manages to outweigh the mere shock value of the topics explored, and the film genuinely engages on an emotional level with an unusual coming of age story.

Credits: Producer, Dean Silvers ; director, writer, David O. Russell ; photography, Michael Mayers ; music, Mark Sandman ; editing, Pamela Martin.
Cast: Jeremy Davies, Elizabeth Newett, Benjamin Hendrickson, Alberta Watson, Carla Gallo.

results.title: Spanish children
results.brief_description: A rural family of southern Spain. Includes a trip by a boy and his father to a city market place and an evening at home to celebrate his sister’s birthday.

results.title: Spain: the land and the people
results.brief_description: The film begins by describing Madrid, the capital, including buildings etc, then takes the viewer to Seville in the south of Spain. Maps indicate the nature of the country, consisting mainly of a high plateau. Products include port wine, oranges, raisins, leather, minerals, olives, olive oil etc. Glimpses are shown of a Spanish family at home and at work, the children at school, their games etc.

results.title: Spain: a journey with Washington Irving
results.brief_description: This film retraces the path of Irving’s original journey through Spain today. Includes visits to the bullring at Pamplona; the art treasures of the Prado in Madrid; La Mancha, the legendary home of Don Quixote and finally the city of Barcelona.
